$interpreted: Zola: (He looks...exactly like him...)
Zola: Hello~Morris Dietrich~
Zola: ...No, I ought to call you "an Immortal".
Morris: Who are you? How do you know my name?
Zola: I've seen you before...you just don't know it.
Barbara: Why are you attacking the students? Explain yourself, Dracontine!
Morris: ...Dracontine...?
Zola: "Help me determine whether or not this knowledge should be revealed to the world." Isn't this your wish, Headmaster?
Zola: Whoever knows must die!——That is your answer!
Barbara: Damn...Chevalier, protect the Academy!
Zola: The show's over, Mr. Dietrich. And yet you've done nothing~
Zola: Are you wondering which side you should be on?
Morris: ...I don't particiapte in meaningless activities. If you're here for me, tell me why.
Zola: Hehe, as you wish.
Zola: The technique of bringing you back from a Crystallized state comes from us, the Dracontines. We call it mystical reincarnation.
Zola: This...grants one immortality.
Morris: So long as the vessel is replaced, one can live forever?
Zola: Indeed.
Zola: Since you are a newly born Immortal, I am here to pose you a question.
Morris: Speak.

Zola: Reincarnation is the mystical art that has been passed down from ancient times. 

It may only be possessed by the Immortals. It must not be given to others frivolously.
Zola: And what...shall I do with you?
Morris: If you don't kill me, then let me join you.
Zola: Truly worthy. That is correct.
Zola: The choice is yours. If you choose to die, I will do it myself, as a sign of respect.
Morris: Thank you. However...
Morris: ...first you must deal with him.
Charle: I've finally got you!
Zola: Charle Ceres...you should not be here!
Tica: Hehe~all thanks to Tica's custom Owl Egg! That's what got Headmaster Ceres back here just in time!
Charle: All you wrote was "Something big happened." Who could tell what that even means?
Tica: Ehhhh~Tica didn't know what to write!
Charle: Tica just told me what's going on.
Charle: I can feel it...Morris, it really is you.
Morris: ...Ah, yes.
Charle: Excellent, I can still talk with you.
Charle: ...There's much I want to say to you.
Charle: But first, we must take down this woman.
Charle: It wasn't just the Desert Kingdom, but the explosion in Atlas as well! It was you Dracontines, controlling things behind the scenes, wasn't it!?
Morris: This is related to the explosion in Atlas?
Tica: Yea!?
Charle: By fair means or foul, it was you who wanted to open the void and let the monsters out. Why would you do that!?
Zola: Oh...
Zola: ...Hmph, hahahahaha.
Zola: You're nothing more than an imposter. You've no right to hear an answer from me!
Charle: Let's see about that. I swear upon all those that have passed, today the truth will be known.
Charle: ...What the...
Charle: Morris...?
Morris: Tell me, woman. These Immortals, how old are they?
Zola: ...From the name it can be known. Dracontines have been around since the time the dragon existed.
Morris: I see. That's old enough.
Morris: I'm sorry, Charle...I want to know. If those Immortals are in possession of the most ancient knowledge...
Charle: ......!?
Charle: ...Morris, you...
Morris: I choose to join the Dracontines, woman.
Zola: Wise decision. Now destroy these worthless insects.
Morris: Wait!
Zola: Why do you stop me!? You——
Morris: Blabbering woman. Be patient.
Morris: It would be much better to use them as test subjects than to kill them all here.
Zola: ...Explain yourself. What kind of experiment?
Morris: ...Something that has long been banned by the Academy, that which neither Life Magic nor Applied Magic could research.
Morris: ——The Forbidden Runes.

Model.Text: (He looks...exactly like him...)
Hello~Morris Dietrich~
...No, I ought to call you "an Immortal".
Who are you? How do you know my name?
I've seen you before...you just don't know it.
Why are you attacking the students? Explain yourself, Dracontine!
...Dracontine...?
"Help me determine whether or not this knowledge should be revealed to the world." Isn't this your wish, Headmaster?
Whoever knows must die!——That is your answer!

Are you wondering which side you should be on?
...I don't particiapte in meaningless activities. If you're here for me, tell me why.

This...grants one immortality.

Indeed.
Since you are a newly born Immortal, I am here to pose you a question.
Speak.

Reincarnation is the mystical art that has been passed down from ancient times.

Truly worthy. That is correct.
The choice is yours. If you choose to die, I will do it myself, as a sign of respect.
Thank you. However...

I've finally got you!

Tica just told me what's going on.
I can feel it...Morris, it really is you.
...Ah, yes.
Excellent, I can still talk with you.
...There's much I want to say to you.
But first, we must take down this woman.
It wasn't just the Desert Kingdom, but the explosion in Atlas as well! It was you Dracontines, controlling things behind the scenes, wasn't it!?
This is related to the explosion in Atlas?
Yea!?

Oh...
...Hmph, hahahahaha.
You're nothing more than an imposter. You've no right to hear an answer from me!
Let's see about that. I swear upon all those that have passed, today the truth will be known.
...What the...
Morris...?
Tell me, woman. These Immortals, how old are they?
...From the name it can be known. Dracontines have been around since the time the dragon existed.
I see. That's old enough.
I'm sorry, Charle...I want to know. If those Immortals are in possession of the most ancient knowledge...
...Morris, you...
I choose to join the Dracontines, woman.
Wise decision. Now destroy these worthless insects.
Wait!
Why do you stop me!? You——
Blabbering woman. Be patient.
It would be much better to use them as test subjects than to kill them all here.
...Explain yourself. What kind of experiment?
...Something that has long been banned by the Academy, that which neither Life Magic nor Applied Magic could research.
——The Forbidden Runes.
